Pre-Game Insights: Chicago Bulls and San Antonio Spurs will play in non-conference action on January 7, 2025.
The Bulls have a home record of 6-11 and rank third in the Eastern Conference in rebounding, averaging 45.1 rebounds per game.
Nikola Vucevic leads the Bulls with 10.1 rebounds per game.
The Spurs have a road record of 6-9 and are 10-3 when they turn the ball over less than their opponents.
The Bulls are shooting 46.9% from the field this season, which is higher than the 45.3% the Spurs allow to opponents.
The Spurs average 13.5 made 3-pointers per game this season, slightly more than the Bulls allow.
Nikola Vucevic is averaging 20.4 points, 10.1 rebounds, and 3.3 assists for the Bulls.
Julian Champagnie is shooting 43.3% and averaging 12.1 points for the Spurs.
In their last 10 games, the Bulls have a record of 6-4, averaging 114.7 points per game.
In their last 10 games, the Spurs have a record of 5-5, averaging 111.1 points per game.
Bulls players Torrey Craig and Ayo Dosunmu are listed as day-to-day with leg and achilles injuries, respectively.
